lead_paragraph: Emmanuel Moody, the second-leading rusher for Southern California last season as a freshman, has decided to transfer. Moody, a 6-foot-1, 205-pound sophomore from Texas who is caught in a glut of highly regarded tailbacks, gained 458 yards on 79 carries last season before missing the final four games because of a sprained ankle. He entered camp as one of 10 players competing for playing time at tailback.
